DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Surgical Procedure Surgical Incision Length Performed Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the length measurement, in cm, of a cut, performed by manual and/or instrumental means, in the skin to allow removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue of the colon, rectum, or to the entire large bowel relating.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Surgical Procedure Surgical Incision Length Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the length or linear extent in space from one end to the other of a cut, performed by manual and/or instrumental means, in the skin to allow removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue of the colon, rectum, or to the entire large bowel relating.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: (in-SIH-zhun) A cut made in the body to perform surgery.:Length; the linear extent in space from one end to the other.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: An intentional cut made to an individual's body with the intent of performing a diagnostic or therapeutic intervention.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the length, in cm, of a surgical incision.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement

DataElement.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form
